text: The 2017 Temple Owls football team represented Temple University in the 2017 NCAA Division I FBS football season. The Owls were led by first-year head coach Geoff Collins and played their home games at Lincoln Financial Field. They were members of the East Division of the American Athletic Conference. They finished the season 7–6, 4–4 in AAC play to finish in third place in the East Division. They were invited to the Gasparilla Bowl where they defeated FIU. ==Schedule== http://www.fbschedules.com/ncaa-17/2017-temple-owls- football-schedule.php ==Personnel== ===Coaching staff=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |Geoff Collins||Head Coach|| 2017 |- align="center" |Dave Patenaude||Offensive Coordinator / Quarterbacks|| 2017 |- align="center" |Taver Johnson||Defensive Coordinator|| 2017 |- align="center" |Ed Foley||Tight ends / Special Teams|| 2008 |- align="center" |Tony Lucas||Running backs|| 2017 |- align="center" |Stan Hixon||Wide receivers|| 2017 |- align="center" |Chris Wiesehan||Offensive Line||2014 |- align="center" |Andrew Thacker||Linebackers|| 2017 |- align="center" |Jim Panagos||Defensive Line||2017 |- align="center" |Cory Robinson||Defensive backs|| 2017 |- align="center" |Tim Conner||Offensive Analyst||2017 |- align="center" |Josh Linam||Defensive Analyst||2017 |- align="center" |David Feeley||Head Strength & Conditioning Coach||2017 |- align="center" |Adam DiMichele||Offensive Quality Control/Recruiting||2014 |- align="center" |} ===Roster=== ===2017 Recruiting class=== ==Game summaries== ===Notre Dame=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" !
